00045 /* array utility function */
00046 int PyC_AsArray(void *array, PyObject *value, const Py_ssize_t length,
00047                 const PyTypeObject *type, const short is_double, const char *error_prefix)
00048 {
00049     PyObject *value_fast;
00050     Py_ssize_t value_len;
00051     Py_ssize_t i;
00052 
00053     if (!(value_fast = PySequence_Fast(value, error_prefix))) {
00054         return -1;
00055     }
00056 
00057     value_len = PySequence_Fast_GET_SIZE(value_fast);
00058 
00059     if (value_len != length) {
00060         Py_DECREF(value);
00061         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00062                      "%.200s: invalid sequence length. expected %d, got %d",
00063                      error_prefix, length, value_len);
00064         return -1;
00065     }
00066 
00067     /* for each type */
00068     if (type == &PyFloat_Type) {
00069         if (is_double) {
00070             double *array_double = array;
00071             for (i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00072                 array_double[i] = PyFloat_AsDouble(PySequence_Fast_GET_ITEM(value_fast, i));
00073             }
00074         }
00075         else {
00076             float *array_float = array;
00077             for (i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00078                 array_float[i] = PyFloat_AsDouble(PySequence_Fast_GET_ITEM(value_fast, i));
00079             }
00080         }
00081     }
00082     else if (type == &PyLong_Type) {
00083         /* could use is_double for 'long int' but no use now */
00084         int *array_int = array;
00085         for (i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00086             array_int[i] = PyLong_AsSsize_t(PySequence_Fast_GET_ITEM(value_fast, i));
00087         }
00088     }
00089     else if (type == &PyBool_Type) {
00090         int *array_bool = array;
00091         for (i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00092             array_bool[i] = (PyLong_AsSsize_t(PySequence_Fast_GET_ITEM(value_fast, i)) != 0);
00093         }
00094     }
00095     else {
00096         Py_DECREF(value_fast);
00097         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00098                      "%s: internal error %s is invalid",
00099                      error_prefix, type->tp_name);
00100         return -1;
00101     }
00102 
00103     Py_DECREF(value_fast);
00104 
00105     if (PyErr_Occurred()) {
00106         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00107                      "%s: one or more items could not be used as a %s",
00108                      error_prefix, type->tp_name);
00109         return -1;
00110     }
00111 
00112     return 0;
00113 }

00116 /* for debugging */
00117 void PyC_ObSpit(const char *name, PyObject *var)
00118 {
00119     fprintf(stderr, "<%s> : ", name);
00120     if (var == NULL) {
00121         fprintf(stderr, "<NIL>");
00122     }
00123     else {
00124         PyObject_Print(var, stderr, 0);
00125         fprintf(stderr, " ref:%d ", (int)var->ob_refcnt);
00126         fprintf(stderr, " ptr:%p", (void *)var);
00127         
00128         fprintf(stderr, " type:");
00129         if (Py_TYPE(var))
00130             fprintf(stderr, "%s", Py_TYPE(var)->tp_name);
00131         else
00132             fprintf(stderr, "<NIL>");
00133     }
00134     fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00135 }

00137 void PyC_LineSpit(void)
00138 {
00139 
00140     const char *filename;
00141     int lineno;
00142 
00143     /* Note, allow calling from outside python (RNA) */
00144     if (!PYC_INTERPRETER_ACTIVE) {
00145         fprintf(stderr, "python line lookup failed, interpreter inactive\n");
00146         return;
00147     }
00148 
00149     PyErr_Clear();
00150     PyC_FileAndNum(&filename, &lineno);
00151     
00152     fprintf(stderr, "%s:%d\n", filename, lineno);
00153 }
00154 
00155 void PyC_FileAndNum(const char **filename, int *lineno)
00156 {
00157     PyFrameObject *frame;
00158     
00159     if (filename) *filename = NULL;
00160     if (lineno)   *lineno = -1;
00161 
00162     if (!(frame = PyThreadState_GET()->frame)) {
00163         return;
00164     }
00165 
00166     /* when executing a script */
00167     if (filename) {
00168         *filename = _PyUnicode_AsString(frame->f_code->co_filename);
00169     }
00170 
00171     /* when executing a module */
00172     if (filename && *filename == NULL) {
00173         /* try an alternative method to get the filename - module based
00174          * references below are all borrowed (double checked) */
00175         PyObject *mod_name = PyDict_GetItemString(PyEval_GetGlobals(), "__name__");
00176         if (mod_name) {
00177             PyObject *mod = PyDict_GetItem(PyImport_GetModuleDict(), mod_name);
00178             if (mod) {
00179                 *filename = PyModule_GetFilename(mod);
00180             }
00181 
00182             /* unlikely, fallback */
00183             if (*filename == NULL) {
00184                 *filename = _PyUnicode_AsString(mod_name);
00185             }
00186         }
00187     }
00188 
00189     if (lineno) {
00190         *lineno = PyFrame_GetLineNumber(frame);
00191     }
00192 }
00193 
00194 void PyC_FileAndNum_Safe(const char **filename, int *lineno)
00195 {
00196     if (!PYC_INTERPRETER_ACTIVE) {
00197         return;
00198     }
00199 
00200     PyC_FileAndNum(filename, lineno);
00201 }

00203 /* Would be nice if python had this built in */
00204 PyObject *PyC_Object_GetAttrStringArgs(PyObject *o, Py_ssize_t n, ...)
00205 {
00206     Py_ssize_t i;
00207     PyObject *item = o;
00208     char *attr;
00209     
00210     va_list vargs;
00211 
00212     va_start(vargs, n);
00213     for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00214         attr = va_arg(vargs, char *);
00215         item = PyObject_GetAttrString(item, attr);
00216         
00217         if (item) 
00218             Py_DECREF(item);
00219         else /* python will set the error value here */
00220             break;
00221         
00222     }
00223     va_end(vargs);
00224     
00225     Py_XINCREF(item); /* final value has is increfed, to match PyObject_GetAttrString */
00226     return item;
00227 }
00228 
00229 /* similar to PyErr_Format(),
00230  *
00231  * implementation - we cant actually preprend the existing exception,
00232  * because it could have _any_ argiments given to it, so instead we get its
00233  * __str__ output and raise our own exception including it.
00234  */
00235 PyObject *PyC_Err_Format_Prefix(PyObject *exception_type_prefix, const char *format, ...)
00236 {
00237     PyObject *error_value_prefix;
00238     va_list args;
00239 
00240     va_start(args, format);
00241     error_value_prefix = PyUnicode_FromFormatV(format, args); /* can fail and be NULL */
00242     va_end(args);
00243 
00244     if (PyErr_Occurred()) {
00245         PyObject *error_type, *error_value, *error_traceback;
00246         PyErr_Fetch(&error_type, &error_value, &error_traceback);
00247         PyErr_Format(exception_type_prefix,
00248                      "%S, %.200s(%S)",
00249                      error_value_prefix,
00250                      Py_TYPE(error_value)->tp_name,
00251                      error_value
00252                      );
00253     }
00254     else {
00255         PyErr_SetObject(exception_type_prefix,
00256                         error_value_prefix
00257                         );
00258     }
00259 
00260     Py_XDECREF(error_value_prefix);
00261 
00262     /* dumb to always return NULL but matches PyErr_Format */
00263     return NULL;
00264 }

00268 #if 0

00270 /* this version uses traceback module but somehow fails on UI errors */
00271 
00272 PyObject *PyC_ExceptionBuffer(void)
00273 {
00274     PyObject *traceback_mod = NULL;
00275     PyObject *format_tb_func = NULL;
00276     PyObject *ret = NULL;
00277 
00278     if (!(traceback_mod = PyImport_ImportModule("traceback"))) {
00279         goto error_cleanup;
00280     }
00281     else if (!(format_tb_func = PyObject_GetAttrString(traceback_mod, "format_exc"))) {
00282         goto error_cleanup;
00283     }
00284 
00285     ret = PyObject_CallObject(format_tb_func, NULL);
00286 
00287     if (ret == Py_None) {
00288         Py_DECREF(ret);
00289         ret = NULL;
00290     }
00291 
00292 error_cleanup:
00293     /* could not import the module so print the error and close */
00294     Py_XDECREF(traceback_mod);
00295     Py_XDECREF(format_tb_func);
00296 
00297     return ret;
00298 }
00299 #else /* verbose, non-threadsafe version */
00300 PyObject *PyC_ExceptionBuffer(void)
00301 {
00302     PyObject *stdout_backup = PySys_GetObject("stdout"); /* borrowed */
00303     PyObject *stderr_backup = PySys_GetObject("stderr"); /* borrowed */
00304     PyObject *string_io = NULL;
00305     PyObject *string_io_buf = NULL;
00306     PyObject *string_io_mod = NULL;
00307     PyObject *string_io_getvalue = NULL;
00308 
00309     PyObject *error_type, *error_value, *error_traceback;
00310 
00311     if (!PyErr_Occurred())
00312         return NULL;
00313 
00314     PyErr_Fetch(&error_type, &error_value, &error_traceback);
00315 
00316     PyErr_Clear();
00317 
00318     /* import io
00319      * string_io = io.StringIO()
00320      */
00321 
00322     if (!(string_io_mod = PyImport_ImportModule("io"))) {
00323         goto error_cleanup;
00324     }
00325     else if (!(string_io = PyObject_CallMethod(string_io_mod, (char *)"StringIO", NULL))) {
00326         goto error_cleanup;
00327     }
00328     else if (!(string_io_getvalue = PyObject_GetAttrString(string_io, "getvalue"))) {
00329         goto error_cleanup;
00330     }
00331 
00332     Py_INCREF(stdout_backup); // since these were borrowed we don't want them freed when replaced.
00333     Py_INCREF(stderr_backup);
00334 
00335     PySys_SetObject("stdout", string_io); // both of these are freed when restoring
00336     PySys_SetObject("stderr", string_io);
00337 
00338     PyErr_Restore(error_type, error_value, error_traceback);
00339     PyErr_Print(); /* print the error */
00340     PyErr_Clear();
00341 
00342     string_io_buf = PyObject_CallObject(string_io_getvalue, NULL);
00343 
00344     PySys_SetObject("stdout", stdout_backup);
00345     PySys_SetObject("stderr", stderr_backup);
00346 
00347     Py_DECREF(stdout_backup); /* now sys owns the ref again */
00348     Py_DECREF(stderr_backup);
00349 
00350     Py_DECREF(string_io_mod);
00351     Py_DECREF(string_io_getvalue);
00352     Py_DECREF(string_io); /* free the original reference */
00353 
00354     PyErr_Clear();
00355     return string_io_buf;
00356 
00357 
00358 error_cleanup:
00359     /* could not import the module so print the error and close */
00360     Py_XDECREF(string_io_mod);
00361     Py_XDECREF(string_io);
00362 
00363     PyErr_Restore(error_type, error_value, error_traceback);
00364     PyErr_Print(); /* print the error */
00365     PyErr_Clear();
00366 
00367     return NULL;
00368 }
00369 #endif

00372 /* string conversion, escape non-unicode chars, coerce must be set to NULL */
00373 const char *PyC_UnicodeAsByte(PyObject *py_str, PyObject **coerce)
00374 {
00375     const char *result;
00376 
00377     result = _PyUnicode_AsString(py_str);
00378 
00379     if (result) {
00380         /* 99% of the time this is enough but we better support non unicode
00381          * chars since blender doesnt limit this */
00382         return result;
00383     }
00384     else {
00385         PyErr_Clear();
00386 
00387         if (PyBytes_Check(py_str)) {
00388             return PyBytes_AS_STRING(py_str);
00389         }
00390         else if ((*coerce = PyUnicode_EncodeFSDefault(py_str))) {
00391             return PyBytes_AS_STRING(*coerce);
00392         }
00393         else {
00394             /* leave error raised from EncodeFS */
00395             return NULL;
00396         }
00397     }
00398 }
00399 
00400 PyObject *PyC_UnicodeFromByteAndSize(const char *str, Py_ssize_t size)
00401 {
00402     PyObject *result = PyUnicode_FromStringAndSize(str, size);
00403     if (result) {
00404         /* 99% of the time this is enough but we better support non unicode
00405          * chars since blender doesnt limit this */
00406         return result;
00407     }
00408     else {
00409         PyErr_Clear();
00410         /* this means paths will always be accessible once converted, on all OS's */
00411         result = PyUnicode_DecodeFSDefaultAndSize(str, size);
00412         return result;
00413     }
00414 }
00415 
00416 PyObject *PyC_UnicodeFromByte(const char *str)
00417 {
00418     return PyC_UnicodeFromByteAndSize(str, strlen(str));
00419 }
00420 
00421 /*****************************************************************************
00422  * Description: This function creates a new Python dictionary object.
00423  * note: dict is owned by sys.modules["__main__"] module, reference is borrowed
00424  * note: important we use the dict from __main__, this is what python expects
00425  *  for 'pickle' to work as well as strings like this...
00426  * >> foo = 10
00427  * >> print(__import__("__main__").foo)
00428  *
00429  * note: this overwrites __main__ which gives problems with nested calles.
00430  * be sure to run PyC_MainModule_Backup & PyC_MainModule_Restore if there is
00431  * any chance that python is in the call stack.
00432  ****************************************************************************/
00433 PyObject *PyC_DefaultNameSpace(const char *filename)
00434 {
00435     PyInterpreterState *interp = PyThreadState_GET()->interp;
00436     PyObject *mod_main = PyModule_New("__main__");
00437     PyDict_SetItemString(interp->modules, "__main__", mod_main);
00438     Py_DECREF(mod_main); /* sys.modules owns now */
00439     PyModule_AddStringConstant(mod_main, "__name__", "__main__");
00440     if (filename) {
00441         /* __file__ mainly for nice UI'ness */
00442         PyModule_AddObject(mod_main, "__file__", PyUnicode_DecodeFSDefault(filename));
00443     }
00444     PyModule_AddObject(mod_main, "__builtins__", interp->builtins);
00445     Py_INCREF(interp->builtins); /* AddObject steals a reference */
00446     return PyModule_GetDict(mod_main);
00447 }
00448 
00449 /* restore MUST be called after this */
00450 void PyC_MainModule_Backup(PyObject **main_mod)
00451 {
00452     PyInterpreterState *interp = PyThreadState_GET()->interp;
00453     *main_mod = PyDict_GetItemString(interp->modules, "__main__");
00454     Py_XINCREF(*main_mod); /* don't free */
00455 }
00456 
00457 void PyC_MainModule_Restore(PyObject *main_mod)
00458 {
00459     PyInterpreterState *interp = PyThreadState_GET()->interp;
00460     PyDict_SetItemString(interp->modules, "__main__", main_mod);
00461     Py_XDECREF(main_mod);
00462 }

00464 /* must be called before Py_Initialize, expects output of BLI_get_folder(BLENDER_PYTHON, NULL) */
00465 void PyC_SetHomePath(const char *py_path_bundle)
00466 {
00467     if (py_path_bundle == NULL) {
00468         /* Common enough to have bundled *nix python but complain on OSX/Win */
00469 #if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(_WIN32)
00470         fprintf(stderr, "Warning! bundled python not found and is expected on this platform. "
00471                 "(if you built with CMake: 'install' target may have not been built)\n");
00472 #endif
00473         return;
00474     }
00475     /* set the environment path */
00476     printf("found bundled python: %s\n", py_path_bundle);
00477 
00478 #ifdef __APPLE__
00479     /* OSX allow file/directory names to contain : character (represented as / in the Finder)
00480      * but current Python lib (release 3.1.1) doesn't handle these correctly */
00481     if (strchr(py_path_bundle, ':'))
00482         printf("Warning : Blender application is located in a path containing : or / chars\
00483                \nThis may make python import function fail\n");
00484 #endif
00485 
00486 #ifdef _WIN32
00487     /* cmake/MSVC debug build crashes without this, why only
00488      * in this case is unknown.. */
00489     {
00490         BLI_setenv("PYTHONPATH", py_path_bundle);
00491     }
00492 #endif
00493 
00494     {
00495         static wchar_t py_path_bundle_wchar[1024];
00496 
00497         /* cant use this, on linux gives bug: #23018, TODO: try LANG="en_US.UTF-8" /usr/bin/blender, suggested 22008 */
00498         /* mbstowcs(py_path_bundle_wchar, py_path_bundle, FILE_MAXDIR); */
00499 
00500         BLI_strncpy_wchar_from_utf8(py_path_bundle_wchar, py_path_bundle,
00501                                     sizeof(py_path_bundle_wchar) / sizeof(wchar_t));
00502 
00503         Py_SetPythonHome(py_path_bundle_wchar);
00504         // printf("found python (wchar_t) '%ls'\n", py_path_bundle_wchar);
00505     }
00506 }

00508 /* Would be nice if python had this built in */
00509 void PyC_RunQuicky(const char *filepath, int n, ...)
00510 {
00511     FILE *fp = fopen(filepath, "r");
00512 
00513     if (fp) {
00514         PyGILState_STATE gilstate = PyGILState_Ensure();
00515 
00516         va_list vargs;  
00517 
00518         int *sizes = PyMem_MALLOC(sizeof(int) * (n / 2));
00519         int i;
00520 
00521         PyObject *py_dict = PyC_DefaultNameSpace(filepath);
00522         PyObject *values = PyList_New(n / 2); /* namespace owns this, don't free */
00523 
00524         PyObject *py_result, *ret;
00525 
00526         PyObject *struct_mod = PyImport_ImportModule("struct");
00527         PyObject *calcsize = PyObject_GetAttrString(struct_mod, "calcsize"); /* struct.calcsize */
00528         PyObject *pack = PyObject_GetAttrString(struct_mod, "pack"); /* struct.pack */
00529         PyObject *unpack = PyObject_GetAttrString(struct_mod, "unpack"); /* struct.unpack */
00530 
00531         Py_DECREF(struct_mod);
00532 
00533         va_start(vargs, n);
00534         for (i = 0; i * 2 < n; i++) {
00535             char *format = va_arg(vargs, char *);
00536             void *ptr = va_arg(vargs, void *);
00537 
00538             ret = PyObject_CallFunction(calcsize, (char *)"s", format);
00539 
00540             if (ret) {
00541                 sizes[i] = PyLong_AsSsize_t(ret);
00542                 Py_DECREF(ret);
00543                 ret = PyObject_CallFunction(unpack, (char *)"sy#", format, (char *)ptr, sizes[i]);
00544             }
00545 
00546             if (ret == NULL) {
00547                 printf("PyC_InlineRun error, line:%d\n", __LINE__);
00548                 PyErr_Print();
00549                 PyErr_Clear();
00550 
00551                 PyList_SET_ITEM(values, i, Py_None); /* hold user */
00552                 Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00553 
00554                 sizes[i] = 0;
00555             }
00556             else {
00557                 if (PyTuple_GET_SIZE(ret) == 1) {
00558                     /* convenience, convert single tuples into single values */
00559                     PyObject *tmp = PyTuple_GET_ITEM(ret, 0);
00560                     Py_INCREF(tmp);
00561                     Py_DECREF(ret);
00562                     ret = tmp;
00563                 }
00564 
00565                 PyList_SET_ITEM(values, i, ret); /* hold user */
00566             }
00567         }
00568         va_end(vargs);
00569         
00570         /* set the value so we can access it */
00571         PyDict_SetItemString(py_dict, "values", values);
00572 
00573         py_result = PyRun_File(fp, filepath, Py_file_input, py_dict, py_dict);
00574 
00575         fclose(fp);
00576 
00577         if (py_result) {
00578 
00579             /* we could skip this but then only slice assignment would work
00580              * better not be so strict */
00581             values = PyDict_GetItemString(py_dict, "values");
00582 
00583             if (values && PyList_Check(values)) {
00584 
00585                 /* don't use the result */
00586                 Py_DECREF(py_result);
00587                 py_result = NULL;
00588 
00589                 /* now get the values back */
00590                 va_start(vargs, n);
00591                 for (i = 0; i * 2 < n; i++) {
00592                     char *format = va_arg(vargs, char *);
00593                     void *ptr = va_arg(vargs, void *);
00594                     
00595                     PyObject *item;
00596                     PyObject *item_new;
00597                     /* prepend the string formatting and remake the tuple */
00598                     item = PyList_GET_ITEM(values, i);
00599                     if (PyTuple_CheckExact(item)) {
00600                         int ofs = PyTuple_GET_SIZE(item);
00601                         item_new = PyTuple_New(ofs + 1);
00602                         while (ofs--) {
00603                             PyObject *member = PyTuple_GET_ITEM(item, ofs);
00604                             PyTuple_SET_ITEM(item_new, ofs + 1, member);
00605                             Py_INCREF(member);
00606                         }
00607 
00608                         PyTuple_SET_ITEM(item_new, 0, PyUnicode_FromString(format));
00609                     }
00610                     else {
00611                         item_new = Py_BuildValue("sO", format, item);
00612                     }
00613 
00614                     ret = PyObject_Call(pack, item_new, NULL);
00615 
00616                     if (ret) {
00617                         /* copy the bytes back into memory */
00618                         memcpy(ptr, PyBytes_AS_STRING(ret), sizes[i]);
00619                         Py_DECREF(ret);
00620                     }
00621                     else {
00622                         printf("PyC_InlineRun error on arg '%d', line:%d\n", i, __LINE__);
00623                         PyC_ObSpit("failed converting:", item_new);
00624                         PyErr_Print();
00625                         PyErr_Clear();
00626                     }
00627 
00628                     Py_DECREF(item_new);
00629                 }
00630                 va_end(vargs);
00631             }
00632             else {
00633                 printf("PyC_InlineRun error, 'values' not a list, line:%d\n", __LINE__);
00634             }
00635         }
00636         else {
00637             printf("PyC_InlineRun error line:%d\n", __LINE__);
00638             PyErr_Print();
00639             PyErr_Clear();
00640         }
00641 
00642         Py_DECREF(calcsize);
00643         Py_DECREF(pack);
00644         Py_DECREF(unpack);
00645 
00646         PyMem_FREE(sizes);
00647 
00648         PyGILState_Release(gilstate);
00649     }
00650 }
00651 
00652 /* generic function to avoid depending on RNA */
00653 void *PyC_RNA_AsPointer(PyObject *value, const char *type_name)
00654 {
00655     PyObject *as_pointer;
00656     PyObject *pointer;
00657 
00658     if (!strcmp(Py_TYPE(value)->tp_name, type_name) &&
00659         (as_pointer = PyObject_GetAttrString(value, "as_pointer")) != NULL &&
00660         PyCallable_Check(as_pointer))
00661     {
00662         void *result = NULL;
00663 
00664         /* must be a 'type_name' object */
00665         pointer = PyObject_CallObject(as_pointer, NULL);
00666         Py_DECREF(as_pointer);
00667 
00668         if (!pointer) {
00669             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_SystemError, "value.as_pointer() failed");
00670             return NULL;
00671         }
00672         result = PyLong_AsVoidPtr(pointer);
00673         Py_DECREF(pointer);
00674         if (!result) {
00675             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_SystemError, "value.as_pointer() failed");
00676         }
00677 
00678         return result;
00679     }
00680     else {
00681         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00682                      "expected '%.200s' type found '%.200s' instead",
00683                      type_name, Py_TYPE(value)->tp_name);
00684         return NULL;
00685     }
00686 }
00687 
00688 
00689 /* PyC_FlagSet_* functions - so flags/sets can be interchanged in a generic way */
00690 #include "BLI_dynstr.h"
00691 #include "MEM_guardedalloc.h"
00692 
00693 char *PyC_FlagSet_AsString(PyC_FlagSet *item)
00694 {
00695     DynStr *dynstr = BLI_dynstr_new();
00696     PyC_FlagSet *e;
00697     char *cstring;
00698 
00699     for (e = item; item->identifier; item++) {
00700         BLI_dynstr_appendf(dynstr, (e == item) ? "'%s'" : ", '%s'", item->identifier);
00701     }
00702 
00703     cstring = BLI_dynstr_get_cstring(dynstr);
00704     BLI_dynstr_free(dynstr);
00705     return cstring;
00706 }
00707 
00708 int PyC_FlagSet_ValueFromID_int(PyC_FlagSet *item, const char *identifier, int *value)
00709 {
00710     for ( ; item->identifier; item++) {
00711         if (strcmp(item->identifier, identifier) == 0) {
00712             *value = item->value;
00713             return 1;
00714         }
00715     }
00716 
00717     return 0;
00718 }
00719 
00720 int PyC_FlagSet_ValueFromID(PyC_FlagSet *item, const char *identifier, int *value, const char *error_prefix)
00721 {
00722     if (PyC_FlagSet_ValueFromID_int(item, identifier, value) == 0) {
00723         const char *enum_str = PyC_FlagSet_AsString(item);
00724         PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00725                      "%s: '%.200s' not found in (%s)",
00726                      error_prefix, identifier, enum_str);
00727         MEM_freeN((void *)enum_str);
00728         return -1;
00729     }
00730 
00731     return 0;
00732 }
00733 
00734 /* 'value' _must_ be a set type, error check before calling */
00735 int PyC_FlagSet_ToBitfield(PyC_FlagSet *items, PyObject *value, int *r_value, const char *error_prefix)
00736 {
00737     /* set of enum items, concatenate all values with OR */
00738     int ret, flag = 0;
00739 
00740     /* set looping */
00741     Py_ssize_t pos = 0;
00742     Py_ssize_t hash = 0;
00743     PyObject *key;
00744 
00745     *r_value = 0;
00746 
00747     while (_PySet_NextEntry(value, &pos, &key, &hash)) {
00748         const char *param = _PyUnicode_AsString(key);
00749 
00750         if (param == NULL) {
00751             PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00752                          "%.200s expected a string, not %.200s",
00753                          error_prefix, Py_TYPE(key)->tp_name);
00754             return -1;
00755         }
00756 
00757         if (PyC_FlagSet_ValueFromID(items, param, &ret, error_prefix) < 0) {
00758             return -1;
00759         }
00760 
00761         flag |= ret;
00762     }
00763 
00764     *r_value = flag;
00765     return 0;
00766 }
00767 
00768 PyObject *PyC_FlagSet_FromBitfield(PyC_FlagSet *items, int flag)
00769 {
00770     PyObject *ret = PySet_New(NULL);
00771     PyObject *pystr;
00772 
00773     for ( ; items->identifier; items++) {
00774         if (items->value & flag) {
00775             pystr = PyUnicode_FromString(items->identifier);
00776             PySet_Add(ret, pystr);
00777             Py_DECREF(pystr);
00778         }
00779     }
00780 
00781     return ret;
00782 }
